content.question: An experiment is conducted such that an applied force is exerted on a <math alttext="2 kilograms " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> object as it travels across a horizontal surface. A graph of the net force exerted on the object as a function of the objectâ€™s distance traveled is shown. How could a student use the graph to determine the work done by the applied force?

choices.label: Multiply the maximum value of the applied force by the total distance the object traveled.
Multiply the weight of the object by the total distance traveled by the object.
Calculate the slope of the line of best fit.

Calculate the area bound by the line of best fit and the horizontal axis from <math alttext="0 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="3 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Calculate the area bound by the line of best fit and the horizontal axis from <math alttext="0 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="3 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
